1.title: Cauliflower Kraft and Italpasta
1.plot: It's time to grin and bear some cauliflower Kraft macs (white cheddar and original), and finally try the Italpastas.

2.title: IGA Macs
2.plot: It's a full lineup of IGA macs. In addition, Frankie and Jon talk about everything from Fuller House to childhood urban legends to their town's school system politics.

3.title: Bega vs. Australian Kraft
3.plot: There's mac and cheese drama in Australia. Bega was making Kraft mac, but Heinz and Mondelez international merged and took it back. How do they compare? Also, we have a UK Kraft deluxe.

1.title: Kraft Original vs. Market Pantry
1.plot: Target's brand of macaroni and cheese, "Market Pantry," is 27 cents less (retail) than Kraft Original. Is it worth it? Junt will tell ya, this week on BoxMac.

2.title: Battle of the Cheap
2.plot: Today, how low can you go? Junt pits the 39 cent Price Rite BoxMac against an unbranded Wal-Mart box.

3.title: Battle of the Organics
3.plot: Junt goes into the crunchy section and pulls out "Back to Nature" and "Annie's" organic macs. It's end to end organic, all USDA certified. Special guest host EJ Massa.

4.title: Kraft Three Cheese vs. Kraft Four Cheese Deluxe
4.plot: Junt's excited as two of his favorite boxmacs square off. One's his classic favorite, and the other has a cheese sauce mix. Is the extra cheese worth it? Today on BoxMac.

5.title: Viewer Submitted Mac
5.plot: Viewers submitted the Everyday 365 Shells and Alfredo, and the Cheese Club traditional mac, found for 33 cents. How do they compare?

6.title: Vegan Macs
6.plot: Vegan Nina co-stars to try Leahey Gardens vs. Earth Balance mac and cheese brands, and teach us a few things about almond milk, non-dairy spreads, and more. Junt has never tried vegan mac before, and knows almost nothing about vegan cuisine. Nina is here to educate.

7.title: Goldfish Nacho Mac vs. Spongebob Shapes
7.plot: Goldfish Nacho Cheese Mac squares off against Kraft Spongebob Shapes - which will fall apart? Which do we prefer? Guest starring EJ from Excitement Bicycle.

8.title: Rapid Mac Cooker
8.plot: Junt finally reviews the Rapid Mac Cooker. We cook Kraft Three Cheese, our favorite mac, with both the Rapid Mac Cooker and the traditional stove method. What are the results? From Chris Johnson, the entrepreneur featured on ABC's Shark Tank, could Rapid Mac really be the best cooking tool for box mac that you'll need for your home or dorm? We put it to the test.

9.title: Coolduder's Fatal Four Way
9.plot: YouTube personality Coolduder (Shawn C. Phillips) sends in four macs - "Our Specialty," "Pssst," "Best Choice," and "Back to Nature White Cheddar and Shells." Can Junt manage the flurry of macs?

10.title: Frozen Macs
10.plot: This week - Stouffer's vs. Boston Market. Frankie and Junt trash Boston Market for what it has become, and have other sensible conversation while the microwave ticks down.

11.title: Kraft Deluxe Reformulation
11.plot: Kraft has reformulated its deluxe boxed macaroni and cheese. Is it different? The same? Better? Worse? SAME PRICE?. Find out.

12.title: Kraft Dinner Original vs. Kraft Original
12.plot: Junt's Canadian friend Adam brings a bevy of Canadian Kraft Dinner. This is the first of a four part series pitting American vs. Canadian macs - first up, Kraft Original.

13.title: Canadian Velveeta vs. Velveeta Shells and Cheese
13.plot: BoxMac continues its tour of Canadian Box Macs and Kraft Dinner. This week, watch Frankie's favorite brand, Velveeta Shells and Cheese, go up against Canadian Velveeta Shells and Cheese, which may or may not technically be Kraft Dinner.

14.title: Kraft Dinner Three Cheese vs. Kraft Three Cheese
14.plot: Junt's ego is on the line as he puts his favorite mac, Kraft Three Cheese, against the Candian equivalent. Will this be the first win for America? Or will Canada be 3 and 0?

15.title: Kraft Dinner Extra Creamy vs. Kraft Thick and Creamy
15.plot: It's 2 to 1, with Canadian mac and cheese in the lead. It all comes down to the Creamy macs - Kraft Dinner Extra Creamy vs. Kraft Thick and Creamy. Will Canada rule supreme, or will America tie it up?

16.title: Gluten Free Macs
16.plot: Nina co-hosts again to look at 4 gluten free macs, made with rice pasta. They're awful.

17.title: FrankenMac vs. Kraft Halloween Shapes
17.plot: This week, the Kraft Keeper tells us the story of a down-on-his-luck pasta chef who thinks he may have made the perfect FrankenMac. But when his friends turns into a bowl of mac and cheese, even he can't boil the problem down.

18.title: Chicago Mega Box - Trail Macs Part 1
18.plot: Jon has received a 12 pound box from Chicago with a bevy of mac and cheeses. This week, we try bizarre "The Valley" and "Mountain House" camping macs.

19.title: Chicago Mega Box - Trail Macs Part 2
19.plot: In part 2 of "Camping Macs," Jon and Frankie continue to cook these ridiculous macs (Mountain House and Valley camping mac and cheeses). They're a pain to cook, and even more painful to eat.

20.title: Macs You Would Never Buy
20.plot: Junt brings "macs you would never buy" to the table - Knorr, Pastaroni, and Chef Boyardee. Are we being unfair? Or do these macs deserve to stay on the shelf?

21.title: Low Cost Deluxes
21.plot: There are more deluxe mac and cheeses beyond Velveeta and Kraft Deluxe. Today, we review low cost deluxes - Loretta from Dollar Tree, and Guaranteed Value from Stop and Shop.

22.title: Easy Macs
22.plot: Easy Mac cups. We try Nacho Cheese, Extra Cheese, Trader Joes, Velveeta, Traditional, and Pizza Flavor. High speed macs.

23.title: Holiday Special - Kraft Homestyle vs. Junt's Homestyle
23.plot: It's the BoxMac Holiday variety hour. Cuddle up with your loved ones and watch as Frankie and Junt try to find the perfect gift for one another, and Junt cooks up his home style recipe with Cheetos crust. Also, enjoy a bonus What's in Junt's Cart? at Benny's.

24.title: Loretta (Dollar Tree) Retake
24.plot: Loretta brand mac and cheese from the Dollar Tree was terrible last time we tried it. Did we get a bad batch or is it somehow that awful?

1.title: Shut Up About Annie's Part 1
1.plot: Annie's - we thought we tried them. We really hadn't. You love Annie's and want to know what we think. Let's do this thing. In part 1, we try some of their easy mac cups, their low sodium offering, their normal mac, and their yummy bunny shaped pasta.

2.title: Shut Up About Annie's Part 2
2.plot: We've only just gotten started with Annie's. In part 2, we try Annie's 4 cheese, the well loved White Shells and Cheddar, and the highly praised shells and real aged cheddar.

3.title: Australian Macs
3.plot: Mac and cheeses from Australia. A friend joins, as he and Frankie visited Sydney several years ago, to see how these bizarre Australian macs fare.

4.title: Viewer Submitted Macs 2
4.plot: Viewers from around the world have been submitting macs to the show. Today, Junt pulls out Wacky Macs, Southern Home, and Safeway from the submitted mac files.

5.title: Texas Box 1 - H.E.B. Macs
5.plot: The macs at night are big and bright when Texas sends us a box full of H.E.B macs to review.

6.title: Canada Cleanup
6.plot: We reviewed a lot of Kraft Dinners, but not all of them. Canadian fan Heather Skypes in to introduce us to KD Smart and ketchup on mac.

7.title: Fancy Pants Macs
7.plot: Some macs are a little too snobby. Nina joins us to review Quinoa, Hodgson Mills, and Trader Joe's.

8.title: Store Brands - Wegman's vs. Key Foods vs. Signature Kitchens
8.plot: If What's In Junt's Cart? has taught us anything, it's that Jon's been to stores before. At least 3. Here, we review KeyFood, Safeway/Signature Kitchens, and Wegmans.

9.title: UK Mac - Scottish McMac vs. England's Chessey and Ham
9.plot: UK Macs. McMac's Cheesey Macaroni and Marshall's Chessey and Ham. Powder your wig and have a pudding.

10.title: UK Macs - Marshall's and Batchelor's Sachet Macs
10.plot: Part 2. This time, we try horrible sachet macs. One from Marshall's, and one from Batchelor's. Let the simmering and waiting begin.

11.title: UK Macs - Marshall's Cheesey Macaroni, Cheesey Pasta, and Cucina Cheesey
11.plot: In the third and final part of the UK mac series, we sample a standard Marshall's, Cucina cheesey pasta, and some kind of formerly Kraft mac that Jon seems to know about.

12.title: Electric Mac and Cheese Maker
12.plot: The rapid mac has competition. This week we try the electric mac cooker with Kraft Three Cheese. We also welcome Angry Kirby on the show to share his awesome fan art with us.

13.title: Three Pirate's Booty Macs
13.plot: Captain Mac Sparrow joins Frankie and Junt to try Pirate's Booty organic mac and cheese.

14.title: Vegan Macs 2 - Daiya, Annie's, and Road's End Organics
14.plot: Nina joins to look at more vegan macs. Daiya Cheezy Mac, Annie's Shells and Creamy Sauce, and Road's End Organics Mac and Chreese.

15.title: Macs Junt Needs to Bring to Frankie's Attention
15.plot: Junt has a bag of odd macs he needs to bring to Frankie's attention - they're all microwavable or instant. Yakisoba, Hormel, Bob Evans, and Maruchan.

16.title: Kraft Removes Artificial Food Dyes!
16.plot: Kraft says they have removed artificial food colors like Yellow 5 and Yellow 6 from their recipe, released it months ago, and no one noticed. Frankie and Jon find the two different formulations to test them, as well as an expired box of the same brand.

17.title: Kids and Baby Macs Kids Cuisine, Kid Fresh, and Lil' Graduates
17.plot: BoxMac needs young girls on the show. So we're joined by Emily Brinkmeyer and her 3-year-old and 8-year-old children EV and Grae. We try a bunch of kid friendly macs that aren't that good.

18.title: Utah Macs (from Smith's, Kent's, Harmon's - Western Family Mac)
18.plot: Emily joins to open a box from San Antonio, TX. It contains some Western Family Macs from Utah Supermarkets, as well as the electric mac and cheese cooker and other macs we've tried. But the documentation is exquisite. Grae also gifts a fart piano to Jon.

19.title: Texas H-E-B Part 2 - Regular, Low Sodium, Whole Grain
19.plot: Emily's back to look at some Texas macs from regional big box store, H-E-B. The crew tries whole grain, low sodium, and regular H-E-B store brand macs.

20.title: Mystery Packages (Trader Joe's Wisconsin Cheddar, America's Choice, Harris Teeter)
20.plot: Emily joins for one final episode, in which Junt and Frankie open three separate packages from fans and find Trader Joe's Wisconsin Cheddar, America's Choice, and Harris Teeter store brand macs.

21.title: Roland Truffle Macs
21.plot: Junt was on vacation, and when he returned, someone dropped a bag of truffle macs on his desk. We try white and whole wheat versions of Roland's truffle oil macs, with bits of mushroom.

22.title: Cracker Barrel Macs - Sharp Cheddar and Havarti
22.plot: Kraft has released a new mac and cheese, under the brand of one of their famous cheeses, Cracker Barrel. Frankie and Junt try the sharp cheddar and Havarti cheddar, and spend most of the episode talking about VHS compilation tapes.

23.title: So Cheesy (Save-A-Lot Store Brand)
23.plot: Zach finally brings something to the show, by showing up with "So Cheesy" deluxes and a traditional prep from Save-A-Lot. Jon and Frankie banter and cook it.

24.title: Macs of the North (Icelandic vs. Kraft Dinner)
24.plot: As the hall of macs begin to expire, Junt and Frankie scramble to assemble shows. Today, they do the final KDs in stock, and pit them against an Icelandic mac.

25.title: Velveeta Bold and Spicy Kraft
25.plot: Under threat of expiry, Frankie and Jon finally explore the Kraft Chipotle/Jalapeño offerings and the Velveeta Bold varieties.

26.title: Kraft Premium Cleanup
26.plot: On their third week of macs about to expire (or, honestly, long expired), the guys review Kraft White Cheddar, Kraft Cheddar Explosion, and Kraft Spirals - all premium offerings hitherto not reviewed on BoxMac.

27.title: 4th of July Mix-in Mac Fest
27.plot: Happy 4th of July from Red Cow Entertainment. You've been asking for mix-ins, and we've got them. Friends of the crew gather at Nina and Frankie's house to mix-in seared beef, taco meat, chourico, roasted red peppers, saugy hot dogs, and Italian sausage. Who will win?

1.title: Key Foods vs. Best Yet vs. Fresh Finds
1.plot: On the final week of expiring macs, Frankie and Junt kinda give up and review three boring random store deluxes - Big Lots' Fresh Finds, Key Foods, and Best Yet.

2.title: Cracker Barrel White Cheddar and Bacon
2.plot: Junt and Frankie return to Cracker Barrel for the other varieties - Sharp Cheddar and Bacon and White Cheddar. They thought they understood the difference between the country store and the Kraft brand. They were wrong.

3.title: Horizon Organics
3.plot: Nina joins the guys as they try Horizon Organics mild cheddar, shells and white cheddar, and deluxe. They learn the difference between USDA and Quality Insurance International, mock the upbeat branding, and use stolen butter.

4.title: Annie's Deluxes
4.plot: Junt and Frankie begrudgingly revisit Annie's to try their deluxe brands - Four Cheese, Aged Real Cheddar, and Gluten Free varieties.

5.title: Kroger vs. Meijer Showdown
5.plot: Fans sent Frankie and Jon a bounty of Kroger and Meijer macs, so they decide to put them had to head. In this show, it's the Thick and Creamy and Three Cheese varieties.

6.title: The Final Rapid Mac Test (and Powders and Sauces)
6.plot: Since we tried the Rapid Mac, we've always wondered, is it just a microwavable plastic bowl with a fill line? We put that to the test, while also trying some cheese powders we were sent, as well as a standalone Velveeta cheese pouch.

7.title: Frozen Evol, Devour, and Marie Callender's
7.plot: Junt buys 4 frozen macs on a very hot day. 3 of them are great. 1 of them dethrones Loretta as the worst mac ever.

8.title: Bargain Frozens
8.plot: Junt brings out four bargain macs - Michelina's, Stouffer's white cheddar and Parmesan and garlic, and banquet. He's also keeping himself cool with a big bottle of Fresca, with gassy results.

9.title: Protein Macs (Muscle Mac, Banza Chickpea, and Horizon Protein)
9.plot: After a year of making fun of protein, Frankie and Junt finally do a protein show. Muscle Mac, Banza Chickpea mac, and Horizon Protein.

10.title: Three Cheese & Cracker Barrel Franken-Macs
10.plot: Junt and Frankie have ran out of macs and BoxMac has disbanded. Junt has gone missing. A young couple arrive in Noodleton with a lead on his whereabouts, but what they find is more horrifying than they could have guessed.

11.title: Vegan Macs 3 - Road's End Shells, Pastariso, and Namaste
11.plot: Nina joins to look at more vegan macs. Daiya Cheezy Mac, Annie's Shells and Creamy Sauce, and Road's End Organics Mac and Chreese.

12.title: Barely Even Macs! - Gnocchi, Lentil Rotini, and Ready-to-Eat
12.plot: Sometimes we get sent macs that aren't all that mac-like. The Giant Eagle Four Cheese Gnocchi, Modern Table Meals Lentil Rotini Homestyle Mac and Cheese, and Pacific Ready-to-Eat Pasta in Cheese Sauce are some such examples.

13.title: Blind Taste Test! Salt, Saltless, and Pre-mixed Cheese
13.plot: Junt loves to pour salt into his pot while cooking mac, but does it make any difference? What about mixing the cheese before dumping the pasta? Can he and Frankie even tell the different preps apart in this blind taste test?

14.title: Holiday Special 2016 Pt. 1 - Mac & Cheesus
14.plot: The first of our two part 2016 Holiday Specials. Junt, Frankie, Nina, Zach, and Angry Kirby convene to decorate, shop at Macy's and Pier 1 Imports, make sugar cookies, and try Mac and Cheesus.

15.title: Holiday Special 2016 Pt. 2 - Junt's Homestyle Redux
15.plot: In part 2, Frankie tries to make a roast to disastrous effect, the guys make wreaths, EJ makes mac with his pressure cooker, and Junt tries another stab at his home style recipe.

16.title: Boring Deluxes - Publix, Valu Time, and Giant Eagle
16.plot: Sometimes, we receive macs in the mail that are just boring, and we have to do them eventually. So we get around to doing these three boring deluxe macs - Publix, Valu Time, and Giant Eagle.

17.title: Boring Dry Macs - Publix, Giant Eagle, Parade, and Always Save
17.plot: Looking through the hall of macs, Junt and Frankie find even more boring macs - Parade, Publix, Always Save, and Giant Eagle. None impress.

18.title: Festival of Spirals Pt. 1 - H.E.B. vs. Kroger vs. Meijer
18.plot: The time, as Ricky Ricardo once said, has come. The Festival of Spirals is here, and Frankie and Junt kick it off with Meijer, Kroger, and H.E.B. varieties.

19.title: Festival of Spirals 2 - Roundy's, Tops, and Signature Kitchens
19.plot: In part two of the Festival of Spirals, Frankie and Junt seek to place a moratorium on the festival of spirals when they review Roundy's, Tops, and Signature Kitchens.

20.title: Bear Creek and Nature Box
20.plot: We take another stab at the all-in-one macs and try three Bear Creeks. We also rush through a Nature Box mac and try to boil a frozen mac from Blount's.

21.title: Blount's, Best Yet Spirals, and Japanese Mac Prep
21.plot: Zach joins to help sort out the instructions in an interesting Japanese mac. Frankie independently makes a box of Best Yet spirals, and the guys finally try the sous vide Blount's mac.

22.title: Japanese Gratin Mac and Great Value Three Cheese
22.plot: After last week's failed attempt, the guys return with renewed spirits and the required ingredients to cook the Japanese Gratin Mac. Also they throw in Wal-Mart's new Great Value Three Cheese to pad out the show a little.

23.title: Sprouts Farmer's Market
23.plot: The guys take a stab at 4 Sprouts Farmer's Market macs - standard, Organic Shells and Cheese, Regular Shells and Cheese, and Shells with Alfredo. They also discuss cinnamon cereals at great length.

24.title: Texas HEB Part 3 - Thick & Creamy, White Cheddar, Deluxe, and Dino Shapes
24.plot: Friend of the show and food blogger Ashley Blom brings the guys an H.E.B. Deluxe. In addition, they get around to trying the Thick and Creamy and White Cheddar H.E.B. varieties, as well as the Hill Country Fare Dino Shapes.

25.title: Homemade Gnocchi & Cheese Part 1
25.plot: Ashley Blom from food blog "Forking Up" guest stars in this two-parter in which she cooks us her homemade gnocchi and cheese, containing bacon, mushrooms, caramelized onions, and a delicious cheese sauce.

26.title: Homemade Gnocchi & Cheese Part 2
26.plot: Ashley Blom from food blog "Forking Up" returns in part two to finish her homemade gnocchi and cheese, containing bacon, mushrooms, caramelized onions, and a delicious cheese sauce.

1.title: Velveeta Broccoli, Bacon, Queso Blanco, and Whole Grain
1.plot: Frankie and Junt return to form to try 4 Velveeta macs they've never tried. Whole Grain, Broccoli, Queso Blanco, and Bacon.

2.title: Mac Magic Pasta Pot and Great Value Thick & Creamy
2.plot: You've seen us do the electric mac and cheese maker - now watch us review a similar product that's mostly the same thing but made of metal and without its own heat source. Plus we do Wal-Mart's Great Value Thick and Creamy because Junt was hungry for something he could count on.

3.title: Nudge Foods Mac & Cheese (from Newfoundland?)
3.plot: Nina joins to help make Nudge Organic Mac and Cheeses, including a gluten free variety. Everyone continues laughing about mummers.

4.title: 3-Ingredient Macaroni and Cheese from the Food Lab
4.plot: After some pushing from fans, Frankie and Junt attempt the 3-ingredient mac and cheese invented by J. Kenji López-Alt (The Food Lab), which includes a Great Value medium cheddar, evaporated milk, and macaroni. Will it work? Or is it just some trendy Internet cooking?

5.title: Cracker Barrel Oven Baked Varieties
5.plot: A NEW Cracker Barrel variety is available. This time, they're oven-baked, and therefore want you to put stupid bread crumbs on top. How do they compare?

6.title: Boring Chuck from Ohio
6.plot: Several episodes back, an angry fan didn't like that we invited our friend Ashley on. In a comment, he referred to her as "Boring Chuck from Ohio," perhaps meaning "boring chick from Ohio," but even at that, she's not from Ohio. To troll back, we introduce a new character, "Boring Chuck from Ohio," to make some very boring macs - Essential Everyday, Gold Emblem, and Hy-Vee.

7.title: MacAweenie and Whole Brown Rice Pasta Side
7.plot: EJ joins the show to cook a rude pasta with the guys...and Junt loses his cool.

8.title: Sophia Italian Pesto, Sun Dried Tomatoes, and Truffle
8.plot: Multiple fans have sent brands of mac that all look the same - similar designs, identical pastas, and same varieties. But none of the boxes have the same branding. What's the deal?

9.title: Korean Cheesy Ramen
9.plot: Aaron and Mike of How Ah We? and other Red Cow fame finally guest on BoxMac to try cheesy ramen macs from Korea.

10.title: Kraft Three Cheese in the Instant Pot
10.plot: Fans have sent us recipes for making boxed macaroni and cheese in the Instant Pot. How does Three Cheese cook up in the Instant Pot?

11.title: Schnucks
11.plot: In a very standard show, Frankie and Junt try St. Louis supermarket Schnucks' macs. Junt's memory of various issues are called into question, and Frankie jukeboxes a portion of the Guardians of the Galaxy Volume 1 and 2 soundtracks.

12.title: 4th of July Mix-in Mac Fest 2017
12.plot: Ashley, Angry Kirby, Boring Chuck, and EJ all swing by to compete with interesting mac mix-ins, including Austin Street Corn mac, Cincinatti Chile mac, Tuna Annie's, and more.

13.title: Butter Replacements (Ghee, Sour Cream, and Canola Oil)
13.plot: Butter and milk - it's what we add to mac and cheese. But why not Sour Cream, or Ghee Butter, or Canola Oil? Here, we replace butter with a few of these options.

14.title: Milk Replacements (Sour Cream, Water, Egg, and Soy Milk)
14.plot: We're back in the Junt Lab. This time, we replace traditional milk with soy milk, egg, water, and sour cream. Is it gross? Is it not? Find out.

15.title: Amy's Frozens (Gluten Free, Dairy Free, and Organic)
15.plot: It took 91 episodes, but we're finally reviewing Amy's Frozen macs. We also discuss family dining chains such as Friendly's, Bickford's, and Ground Round.

16.title: Chef Karlin (Elbows, Shells, and Fast Mac)
16.plot: This week we try Chef Karlin's line of macs. We learn about their food services, reflect on a bizarre moment from Mr. Belvedere, and announce the contest for the old hat.

17.title: Big Y - Original, Thick & Creamy, White Cheddar, and Deluxe
17.plot: BoxMac was sent macs from Big Y. The guys try most of the varieties, except the spirals because we're saving that for the festival of spirals. Junt and Frankie also discuss Sonic Mania and Junt is triggered by how much Frankie paid for his Nintendo Switch.

18.title: Spartan Original, Easy Mac, Thick and Creamy, and Deluxe
18.plot: The guys try Spartan macs. But since that's boring they end up talking about their early Internet experiences the whole time. Also, epic super cut of an acting gesture of Michael Keaton's.

19.title: Baked Pumpkin Macaroni & Cheese
19.plot: It's Macstery Science Theater 3000. Miss Noodle has trapped Junt and Frankie on the Noodle of Love and will force them to try macs and watch strange macaroni and cheese related video content. They're joined by Kraft Keeper and their new robot pal, BotMac. Enjoy the BoxMac Halloween Special 2017.

20.title: Fiesta of Dinos
20.plot: It's the long awaited Fiesta Mac and two Dino Macs. It's a Fiesta of Dinos.

21.title: Festival of Spirals?
21.plot: In a bizarre turn of events, a Festival of Spirals comes through town again. This time with Hy-Vee, Spartans, and Big Y spirals.

22.title: New and Old Australian and UK Macs
22.plot: Keith returns to help the guys work through their remaining Australian and UK macs.

23.title: Kraft Original vs. Market Pantry (Retake)
23.plot: 'Tis the night before the 100th episode, and all through the cheese - we've made you a holiday special, and you didn't even have to say please.

24.title: The 100th Show
24.plot: The 100th episode spectacular. There's ornaments, Frankie makes the home style, we read the eulogy for the old hat, there's a mac and cheese cake, EJ makes a turkey and we all sit down for a nice dinner. We even get visited by some friends, new and old.

1.title: International Festival of Sachets
1.plot: Bachelor's "Pasta 'n' Sauce," "Has No," Heinz Peppa Pig Pasta Shapes, and "Mug Shot Snack Stop!" One of them is slimy and disgusting.

2.title: Vegan Mac Fest Cook Off
2.plot: The BoxMac crew visits VegFest's "Mac Daddy" Vegan Mac Fest. From chick peas to pumpkin macs to curry, Junt, Frankie, and Nina sample several dozen homemade vegan macs in Worcester, MA.

3.title: Easy Macs Cups - Kraft, Market Pantry, Dollar Tree, and Hamburger Helper
3.plot: It's more easy mac cups than BoxMac can handle. Trying them in the studio armed only with a microwave and water from the bathroom, Frankie and Junt try Dollar Tree, Market Pantry Swift Mac, Four Cheese, White Cheddar, and Hamburger Helper microwavable mac and cheeses.

4.title: Expired Meijer Deluxes
4.plot: For some time, the hall of macs has contained four Meijer deluxe macs - four cheese, sharp cheddar, shells, and regular. There's just one problem: they're all over a year past date. The guys debate trying these otherwise interesting macs.

5.title: Deluxes We're Pretty Sure We Haven't Tried
5.plot: Frankie and Junt are PRETTY sure they haven't had these Market Pantry, Hyvee, Everyday Essentials, or Great Value Reduced Fat deluxe macs before...PRETTY sure.

6.title: Bulls*** Macs
6.plot: This week, we review Australia's Heinz canned macaroni and cheese, Dairylea cheese, instant meal Pot Noodle, and Bear Creek's "Grown Up" Beer and Cheese macaroni and cheese.

7.title: EXPENSIVE Williams Sonoma and Village Gourmet Half-Macs
7.plot: Williams Sonoma and Village Gourmet have macs that don't contain all the ingredients. The former has just cheese powder and bread crumbs, the other has just seasoning and pasta. The kicker? They're EXPENSIVE - as high as $26.95. Is it worth it?

8.title: Independently Produced Macs (FishSki and Cheesus Reformulated)
8.plot: It's independently produced macs. Fish Ski Provisions hot chili macs and a reformulated version of Mac and Cheesus.

9.title: Oprah's Horrible Mac and Wicked Kitchen
9.plot: Junt, Nina, and Frankie give Oprah's awful butternut squash refrigerated macaroni and cheese a dishonest try. They also try some very spicy macs from Wicked Kitchen.

10.title: Frozens - Evol Chipotle vs. Cracker Barrel Single Bowl
10.plot: With Jon on his last legs of energy, we attempt to review three frozen macs - two Cracker Barrels (the family style and single bowl sharp cheddar) and the Evil Chipotle Chicken mac and cheese.

11.title: Chrissy's Stuffed Tortellini 6-Cheese Mac
11.plot: Fan and friend of the show Chrissy Fellmeth is in the BoxMac kitchen. She makes her grandmother's classic tortellini mac. Is it all too cheesy?

12.title: Back of the Box Recipes (Kraft Pizza and Fiesta Mac)
12.plot: You know those recipes on the back of macaroni and cheese boxes? Have you ever wondered if they were any good? Today on BoxMac, the guys try a "Fiesta" salsa mac with Stop and Shop's deluxe brand, and a mac and cheese sausage pizza with Kraft Original Deluxe.

13.title: Devour Single Bowls and Cracker Barrel Parmesan
13.plot: BoxMac tries another round of Krafts that few people know are Krafts. Devour Hot and Melty Nacho, Devour Sharp Cheddar, and Devour Creamy Alfredo with Bacon, as well as a new white Parmesan Cracker Barrel.

14.title: The Fourth Awakens
14.plot: In year three of the BoxMac Fourth of July mac fest, the crew opens the festival up to any food at all. Jon brings some chicken, EJ smokes some mac, and Zach shocks everyone.

15.title: Annie's and Simple Truth Organics and Pow! Protein
15.plot: Scouring the hall of macs, Frankie and Junt try some organic and protein-based macs, including Pow!'s White and Sharp Cheddars, Simple Truth Organic's deluxe cheddar, and Annie's Organic Grass Fed Real Aged Cheddar. They also sing sea shanties.

16.title: Cheese Club Express Mac, Four Cheese, and Sharp Cheddar
16.plot: Jon and Frankie have a bunch of Cheese Club macs. Cooking them in the studio, they're going to try the Cheese Club Four Cheese and Sharp Cheddar deluxe macs, and their "express mac" microwaveable brand.

17.title: KD Alfredo, Kraft Mug Mac and Organic, & President's Choice
17.plot: Canadian Adam returns to try Alfredo Kraft Dinner. As well as Canadian President's Choice, a disgusting Kraft "mug mac," and an organic Kraft.

18.title: Goat Cheese Macs
18.plot: We have Funny Farm goat cheese macs (jalapeño, creamy cheddar, and shapes) and Stouffer's new cheddar and goat cheese Mac. What is mac and cheese like when made with goat cheese? We find out. Featuring Canada's Adam.

19.title: Sam's Choice and Gooey Butter Cake
19.plot: A fan sent in an "Ann and Allen" gooey butter cake, and by gummy we're gonna make it. Also, we try five different Sam's Choice Mac and Cheeses - Aged White Cheddar and Black Pepper, Shells and Cheese Con Queso, Shells and Cheese Bacon Cheddar, Italian Four Cheese, and Classic Aged Cheddar.

20.title: Pumpkin Raviolis and Fall Flavored Snacks
20.plot: A horde of mutated boxes of mac descend upon the quiet town of Noodleton. With the death toll rising, two citizens manage to fight back, but will they survive Boxdemic? Please enjoy "Boxdemic: Salt and Cheddar."

21.title: Thanksgiving Mac! - Brie, Turkey, and Cranberries!
21.plot: Junt has come up with a cranberry, brie cheese, turkey Thanksgiving macaroni and cheese. Does it live up to a Thanksgiving meal?

22.title: Mac & Cheese Fudge
22.plot: We try mac and cheese candy canes from Archie McPhee, make eggnog with Jack Daniel, Challah bread with Angry Kirby, a gingerbread house, mac and cheese fudge, and Man-servant Matt made a very special outfit for Jon.

23.title: Mystery Box Challenge
23.plot: Ashley sent us a box of mystery ingredients. Clotted cream, Laughing Cow cheese, Gouda, salami, beer nuts, and sriracha - can Junt and Frankie fashion is into a mac using just those ingredients?

24.title: Sous Vide Steaks and Wal-Mart Artisan Crafted
24.plot: Months ago, Red Cow was sent a Sous Vide product to try. EJ, Frankie, and Junt compare it against their personally owned Sous Vide machines, and they finally try the Wal-Mart Great Value "Artistan Crafted" varieties - Smoke Gouda and Cheddar Harvarti.

imdb.title: BoxMac
plot: Lifelong friends Jon Hunt (Junt) and Frankie Frain try a new set of boxed macaroni and cheeses every Sunday. Watch them banter while cooking America's easiest meal.
